unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Uttar Pradesh**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Uttar Pradesh**

unnormalised: Lucknow, UP – Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, aiming to enhance billing efficiency and reduce power theft. As of 20/10/2024, over 2 million smart meters have been installed, primarily in urban areas like Kanpur and Varanasi.
normalised: Lucknow, U P – Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (U P P C L) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, aiming to enhance billing efficiency and reduce power theft. As of twentieth october two thousand and twenty four, over two million smart meters have been installed, primarily in urban areas like Kanpur and Varanasi.

unnormalised: UPPCL officials report a significant decrease in aggregate technical and commercial (AT&C) losses in areas with smart meter coverage. The initiative is part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) and aims to cover all 2.9 crore electricity consumers by 2025.
normalised: U P P C L officials report a significant decrease in aggregate technical and commercial (A T and C) losses in areas with smart meter coverage. The initiative is part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S) and aims to cover all two point nine crore electricity consumers by two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: "These meters offer real-time monitoring and remote disconnection capabilities, empowering both the utility and consumers," stated Mr. Sharma, Managing Director, UPPCL, during a press briefing at 11:00 AM today. Consumers can now access their consumption data via the 'Urja Mitra' app.
normalised: "These meters offer real-time monitoring and remote disconnection capabilities, empowering both the utility and consumers," stated Mister Sharma, Managing Director, U P P C L, during a press briefing at eleven AM today. Consumers can now access their consumption data via the 'Urja Mitra' app.

unnormalised: Facing initial challenges regarding meter reading accuracy, UPPCL has assured rigorous testing and calibration. A dedicated helpline is available from 09:00 hrs to 18:00 hrs to address consumer grievances. The next phase focuses on integrating renewable energy sources with the smart grid infrastructure. A pilot project in Ayodhya is slated to begin on 01/11/2024.
normalised: Facing initial challenges regarding meter reading accuracy, U P P C L has assured rigorous testing and calibration. A dedicated helpline is available from zero nine zero zero hours to eighteen zero zero hours to address consumer grievances. The next phase focuses on integrating renewable energy sources with the smart grid infrastructure. A pilot project in Ayodhya is slated to begin on first november two thousand and twenty four.
